body:
@aquadzn hello, and thank you for your interest in our work! We don't generally provide feedback on custom data training, however we do offer professional consulting in this area, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production AI solutions for our clients, such as:
- **Cloud-based YOLOv3** surveillance systems operating on **hundreds of HD video streams in realtime**
- **iOS-device YOLOv3** integrated into custom apps for realtime **30 FPS inference**
- **Custom data training**, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination

If you'd like to discuss your requirements in greater detail, please contact Glenn Jocher at glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com or visit us at https://contact.ultralytics.com. Alternatively, we will leave this issue open, and you are free to seek community support here.
Did you check to make sure the labels of the validation set are setup correctly?

> Did you check to make sure the labels of the validation set are setup correctly?

Yes and my labels are correctly displayed on train_batch0.jpg and test_batch0.jpg

@glenn-jocher thanks but I also tried with some of the COCO 2017 dataset but I got the same problem, mAP of zero, F1 of zero ans GIoU of ~6.5 

I don't know what to do

Hello, thank you for your interest in our work! This issue seems to lack the minimum requirements for a proper response, or is insufficiently detailed for us to help you. Please note that most technical problems are due to:

- **Your changes to the default repository**. If your issue is not reproducible in a fresh `git clone` version of this repository we can not debug it. Before going further run this code and ensure your issue persists:
```bash
sudo rm -rf yolov3  # remove existing
git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3 && cd yolov3 # clone latest
python3 detect.py  # verify detection
python3 train.py  # verify training (a few batches only)
# CODE TO REPRODUCE YOUR ISSUE HERE
```
- **Your custom data.** If your issue is not reproducible with COCO data we can not debug it. Visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) for exact details on how to format your custom data. Examine `train_batch0.jpg` and `test_batch0.jpg` for a sanity check of training and testing data.
- **Your environment.** If your issue is not reproducible in a [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) VM we can not debug it. Ensure you meet the requirements specified in the README: Unix, MacOS, or Windows with Python >= 3.7, PyTorch >= 1.3 etc. You can also use our [Google Colab Notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1G8T-VFxQkjDe4idzN8F-hbIBqkkkQnxw) and our [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3) to test your code in working environment.

If none of these apply to you, we suggest you close this issue and raise a new one using the **Bug Report template**, providing screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**. Thank you!

@honghande if I could give you a piece of advice, don't paste hundreds of lines of results, they're completely unreadable. Instead upload your tensorboard plots or your results.png. If you don't see a results.png you can create one with plot_results() in utils.py.

Also when you upload code make sure you mark it as code so it is readable, like `this`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29244715/88456518-e2a12900-ceb0-11ea-8a6d-aace5a3a62e4.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29244715/88456582-298f1e80-ceb1-11ea-8e13-a08df3a5403e.png)
@glenn-jocher 
OK, sorry, the first one is the result of running directly, and the second is the error reported by debug，The operating parameters are as follows:
python train_demo.py --batch-size 4 --img-size 640 --epochs 10
Namespace(adam=False, batch_size=4, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', data='data/coco.data', device='', epochs=10, evolve=False, freeze_layers=False, img_size=[640], multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, rect=False, resume=False, single_cls=False, weights='weights/yolov3.weights')
Using CUDA Apex device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='GeForce RTX 2080 Ti', total_memory=11016MB)

@honghande the first plot shows you have no validation data. If you have no validation data you will not have any metrics like mAP quite obviously.

The second image shows a keyboard interrupt error which you caused yourself.

@glenn-jocher I have validation data. The validation data is 2007_ test.txt There are only four images in the data.Isn't it based on coco.data File path in?
How to find the error in the second image? Thank you for your prompt reply!
@honghande yes I'm sure you have lots of things. My point is your training is not using any validation data.

@glenn-jocher Thank you very much for your immediate reply. During training, each epoch will be verified once. I don't quite understand what you mean. Please give me a detailed explanation. Thank you again!
@honghande you have no validation results because you have no validation data. Correct your data.ymal val path.
